summary: This bill, the Firefighters Assisting Seniors To Emergency Response Act (FASTER Act), authorizes grants to fire departments to implement programs aimed at preventing falls among older adults and reducing response times during in-home emergencies. It focuses on programs like home safety improvements, fall prevention initiatives, and the use of community paramedicine. The bill outlines grant application procedures, allowable uses of funds, and performance evaluation metrics, along with an authorization of appropriations for fiscal years 2026-2035 with a sunset provision in 2036. The Administrator of FEMA will administer the grants.
